brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine the long term safety and preliminary efficacy of
      intramedullary transplantation of HuCNS-SC cells in subjects with thoracic spinal cord
      trauma.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-Term Follow-Up of Transplanted Human Central Nervous System Stem Cells (HuCNS-SC) in Spinal Cord Trauma Subjects

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigation is a multi-year observational study following the completion of the
      open-label, single dose Phase I/II study involving transplantation of allogeneic HuCNS-SC
      cells into 12 subjects with thoracic spinal cord injury.

      Subjects will be monitored at routine intervals for safety and preliminary efficacy for four
      years. The LTFU study will commence following the one year post-transplantation termination
      visit of the Phase I/II investigation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Must have undergone HuCNS-SC transplantation as a subject in the Phase I/II trial

          -  Must agree to comply in good faith with all conditions of the study and to attend all
             required study visits

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Subjects have received or are receiving off-protocol immunosuppressive medications

          -  Subjects who, after completion of Phase I/II trial (Protocol # CL-N02-SC), have
             entered or are about to enter any other investigational study.

study_pop.textblock:
Subjects who had undergone intramedullary transplantation of HuCNS-SC cells in the
        thoracic region.

clinical_study.official_title: Long-term Follow-up (LTFU) Study of the Phase I/II Safety and Preliminary Efficacy Investigation of Intramedullary Spinal Cord Transplantation of HuCNS-SC® in Subjects With Thoracic (T2-T11) Spinal Cord Trauma

primary_outcome.description: Evidence of improvement in ASIA impairment scale as confirmed by neurological examination
primary_outcome.measure: American Spinal Injury Association (ASIA) Impairment Scale Improvement

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
